form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Blumenthal (for himself, Mr. Murphy, Mr. Markey, Ms. Baldwin, Mr. Sanders, and Mrs. Boxer) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

form.official-title: To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to modify the exception to the work requirement.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the SNAP Work Opportunities and Veteran Protection Act of 2015.

section.header: Amendments to the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008

subsection.text: Section 6(o)(3) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2015(o)(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (A) through (E) as clauses (i) through (v), respectively, and indenting appropriately;
by striking the paragraph designation and heading and all that follows through Paragraph (2) and inserting the following:
in clause (iv) of subparagraph (A) (as so redesignated), by striking or at the end;
in clause (v) of subparagraph (A) (as so redesignated), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: not offered a position in a program described in subparagraph (B) or (C) of paragraph (2).
The work requirements under paragraph (2) shall not apply to a veteran (as defined in section 101 of title 38, United States Code) if the veteran—

subclause.text: is participating in a program administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs or a State to further employment or rehabilitation goals, including—

item.text: a mental or physical rehabilitation program;
a program designed to help veterans transition to full- or part-time employment; and

subclause.text: demonstrates participation, if participation is less than 20 hours per week, in the program to the fullest extent that—

item.text: the veteran is physically able; and

clause.text: The 3-month limit under paragraph (2) shall not apply to a veteran who meets the requirements described in clause (i).

subsection.header: Funding of employment and training programs
subsection.text: Section 16(h)(1)(E) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2025(h)(1)(E)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (i)(I), by striking section 6(o)(3) and inserting any of clauses (i) through (v) of section 6(o)(3)(A) or under section 6(o)(3)(B); and
in clause (ii)(II), by striking section 6(o)(3) and inserting any of clauses (i) through (v) of section 6(o)(3)(A) or under section 6(o)(3)(B).

section.text: This Act and the amendments made by this Act shall take effect on the first day of the first fiscal year that begins after the date of enactment of this Act.
